towns.name: George
towns.description: The largest city on the Garden Route, George serves as the economic hub of the Southern Cape with excellent infrastructure and a growing service industry.

towns.name: Knysna
towns.description: Famous for its lagoon and oysters, Knysna is a popular tourist destination with a vibrant local economy.

towns.name: Mossel Bay
towns.description: Historic harbour town and the start of the Garden Route, known for its mild climate and industrial port.

towns.name: Plettenberg Bay
towns.description: Upmarket coastal resort town popular with holidaymakers, known for whale watching and beautiful beaches.

towns.name: Sedgefield
towns.description: Peaceful 'slow town' between Knysna and George, known for its Saturday Wild Oats Market and lagoon.

towns.name: Wilderness
towns.description: Scenic village surrounded by national park, rivers, and pristine beaches. Popular for outdoor activities.

towns.name: Hartenbos
towns.description: Family-friendly beach town adjacent to Mossel Bay, popular holiday destination.

towns.name: Great Brak River
towns.description: Quiet village at the mouth of the Great Brak River, known for its tranquil lagoon.

towns.name: Riversdale
towns.description: Agricultural town on the N2, serving the surrounding farming communities.

towns.name: Albertinia
towns.description: Known as the 'Aloe Capital' of South Africa, small agricultural town with aloe processing industry.

towns.name: Still Bay
towns.description: Coastal holiday town known for fishing, surfing, and the ancient fish traps.

towns.name: Nature's Valley
towns.description: Tiny coastal village nestled in the Tsitsikamma forest, surrounded by nature reserve.

towns.name: Oudtshoorn
towns.description: Capital of the Klein Karoo, famous for ostrich farming, Cango Caves, and Route 62.

towns.name: Calitzdorp
towns.description: The port wine capital of South Africa, small Karoo town on Route 62.

towns.name: De Rust
towns.description: Gateway to Meiringspoort pass, charming village with Victorian architecture.

towns.name: Ladismith
towns.description: Agricultural town known for cheese production and the dramatic Towerkop mountain.

towns.name: Barrydale
towns.description: Artistic Klein Karoo village on Route 62, known for its creative community.

towns.name: Uniondale
towns.description: Historic farming town connecting the Garden Route to the Karoo interior.

towns.name: Prince Albert
towns.description: Picturesque Karoo town known for figs, olives, and the dramatic Swartberg Pass.

regions.name: Garden Route
regions.description: Scenic coastal stretch along South Africa's southern coast, known for lush forests, lagoons, and beaches.

regions.name: Klein Karoo
regions.description: Semi-arid valley region inland from the Garden Route, famous for Route 62, ostriches, and wine.
